intro: Neea mapirensis, commonly known as the Mapire mountain tea, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cool, humid climates. Its botanical features include slender stems, elliptical leaves with a leathery texture, and white or pinkish flowers that bloom in spring. Neea mapirensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and potential medicinal properties.
